WRITING.TEXT: My boss is a sexist pig. On top of the myriad of inappropriate things he has said to me over the years, he lately passed me up for a potential promotion in favor of one of my male employees, despite the fact that I have experience doing this job, and my employee did not. When I confronted my boss about it his literal response was, #8220;The hours can be long, the work can be really dirty, and I honestly didn #8217;t think of it as a woman #8217;s job #8221;. What year did this happen, you might ask? 1975? Nope! 2019. I went straight to HR with it, along with a list of the other shit he has said, like, #8220;School shootings are a direct result of the #8216;women #8217;s movement #8217;. Women aren #8217;t staying home with the kids anymore because they think it #8217;s more important to have JOBS... #8221;, and #8220;isn #8217;t buying flowers a woman #8217;s job? #8221; I could go on and on about this piece of work. (The company has yet to do a goddamned thing about this guy)

I (F) was preparing to replace the water pump and timing belt on my Jetta, but I wanted some latex gloves to keep from getting too much grime all over my hands. I go to my local hardware store and ask the first man I see, #8220;Where can I find your latex gloves? #8221; #8220;What for, washing dishes? #8221;, he asks. #8220;No, for disposing of a body. #8221;, I respond dryly. ::awkward silence::
I bought two boxes and told him it was going to be a big job. #128514;

Another one I (F) had was a neighbor who came knocking at my door. I answer, and he asks, #8220;uh, is the man of the house in? #8221; #8220;I sure am. #8221;, I said. #8220;Uh. Well. I wanted to see if he #8217;s willing to sell his truck that #8217;s parked outside. #8221; #8220;Well, it #8217;s my truck, and I #8217;m not selling it. #8221; ::awkward silence:: He went home and murdered his wife that night #128563;

Yeah...sadly it #8217;s a true story. While at our door the guy seemed like he was tweaking. My husband and I went about our day, and after dinner he goes out back for a smoke and sees flashing red and blues everywhere. We watch as an ambulance drives off slowly, without its lights on. Husband says, #8220;maybe the dude was mad because you were the man of our house, so he and went home and killed his wife. #8221; I figured someone had a heart attack or something. The next morning I get a text from my dad, saying #8220;MURDER NEXT DOOR??? #8221; Turns out my husband was at least half right. They had a fight, she told him she wanted a divorce, and he shot her in the head in their bathroom. Then he called her parents and told them he killed her. They didn #8217;t believe him, so he made his own son get on the phone to confirm. Totally fucked up situation. Don #8217;t do meth, kids.

Thanks! I #8217;ve started buying the thicker nitrile gloves from harbor freight. They work great when you have situations that require a bit more dexterity. I haven #8217;t had too many tears with them so far. I also use them in my job doing materials testing for road construction, and they #8217;re great for that too.
I come from a looooong line of sarcastic assholes. You #8217;re shark bait if you don #8217;t have snarky remark at the ready. #128514;

Champagne Nape. Can be any time, standing, sitting, lying down, but I notice them in the mornings a lot. It just feels/sounds like tiny little champagne bubbles trickling up the nape of my neck. It #8217;s been happening as long as I can remember.
Only old people drive Buicks.

WRITING.TITLE: Found in NW Colorado. It #8217;s about 3 #8217; tall.

WRITING.TEXT: When I was about 12 my dad took my sister and I up camping in the mountains in Colorado. We took a drive one day down what is known as the Last Dollar Road in his old #8216;75 F-250. I remember driving through a Quakey Tree-lined road that opened to a very, very steep slope with about a 200 #8217; drop on the downhill side. We started to traverse the narrow cut in the mountainside when it started absolutely pouring rain. I mean, microburst level rain. This is a dirt road, mind you, and turned into slick mud instantly. I remember feeling the back end of the truck start to slip towards the downhill side, and dad telling us to make sure our seatbelts were on. I knew we weren #8217;t in any danger because dad was in charge, and I was sure had been through worse. He stopped, locked the hubs and put it in 4 low. We still slipped and slid around on that muddy track, but I think he must #8217;ve gotten one wheel into a rut, and we eventually and made it to the other side where the slope evened out. Technically I guess this story is a situation he thought we #8217;d never get out of, because when I asked him about it recently, 20 years after the fact, he still got chills, his hair stood on end, and his eyes started watering just talking about it. He apparently did not have the confidence in his abilities that my naive ass did that day, and he honestly though we were all going to roll down that slope and die that day.

I (32) got my tubes tied and uterus ablated last December. My husband now endearingly calls my womb the #8220;ash heap #8221; (Fallout 76 joke. We are nerds) Since my surgery I #8217;ve been just waiting for someone to ask me when I #8217;m having kids just so I can awkwardly tell them, #8220;my uterus is a barren wasteland, thanks for asking. #8221; Sadly, not one single goddamned person has had the gall to ask about it! I #8217;m slightly disappointed. I feel worse for my parents, because neither of my sisters want to pop out a curtain climber either. Thankfully, mom and dad are A-okay with that decision, but they get annoyed with always being asked, #8220;but don #8217;t you want grandchildren?? #8221;
Thank you! I wish I were going to be here to see it bloom, but I #8217;m only here temporarily for work.
Identified!
I #8217;ll just have to plant some for next year :)
Ack, I love his angry antennae

We have two cats. One is a 10 year old fatty, and the other a part Maine coon 19 year old. Fatty likes to cuddle at bed time, so every night he announces his presence with a series of loud meows as he scrabbles his way on to the bed. We all go to sleep. A few hours later the old one wakes up and wants to eat. However, he doesn #8217;t want to eat alone, so he does this weird cooing meow he ONLY does when summoning the fatso at night. We all wake up, fatty goes to have a midnight snack with old fart, and we go back to sleep. 20 minutes later fatty comes back into the room to cuddle some more, but absolutely must announce his presence again. This cycle repeats until my husband gets up.

Yeah we definitely do. We #8217;ve tried all sorts of things to get them to stop that habit, but nothing so far has worked. We get maybe 1-2 nights a week where they don #8217;t do that. Little shits.
As someone who works out of town a lot, I can totally relate. Especially if work takes you to a small town with few options.

My sister cut her hands at work one night shortly after she started dating her boyfriend. While at the hospital she got the adrenaline shits, but obviously couldn #8217;t wipe herself with fresh gaping wounds on her hands. Man stepped up to the plate and wiped his new girlfriend #8217;s poopy butt for her. That #8217;s some love right there.
Nooooo!
And I thought the bustling metropolis of Craig, CO was bad.
She was holding a crystal bowl that shattered in her hands, or something like that. Blasted crystal all up in her digits.
Same!
When I was a kid I was absolutely terrified of spontaneously combusting.

I don #8217;t typically care about creamer, but I do judge the shit out of a lady I know who made her own #8220;healthy #8221; creamer alternative. It had a whole can of sweetened condensed milk, heavy cream, a shit load of sugar, and flavoring. She #8217;d put 4 tablespoons of that, PLUS 1/4 cup of sugar in her travel mug every day. Then bitch about not being able to lose weight. #129318; #127995; #8205; #9792; #65039;
#128563; nope. All my nopes.
My younger sister absolutely whooping my butt at SSX Tricky. Repeatedly.
Not before it cures.
As someone who works in construction materials testing, I just about shat when I saw #8220;pass through a #10 and #50 sieve. #8221;

Nothing. When I was 21 my mom tried to discourage me from riding motorcycles by graphically describing to me a fatal accident she saw. She was directly behind a man when he ran into a jersey barrier at about 65. She told me about seeing him hit the barrier, fly over it, and land on his head. She described seeing his brain matter on the pavement. Turned out to be my first crush. I was devastated. I hadn #8217;t seen him in a decade, but your first crush always holds a place in your heart. I think about him every July 31st, on the anniversary of his death, and in December on his birthday.
My husband does this, and it drives me bonkers.

I feel for you. During times of extreme stress mine can get to that point. The only thing that has worked as a deterrent for me is to get manicures on the reg. For one thing, I am ashamed to go in and have nasty looking cuticles. Two, they trim the cuticles for me, evening out the uneven bits that I want to pick at. Three, I think about the money I #8217;m spending on manicures and don #8217;t want to make it go to waste by tearing my hands to shreds. Luckily I have a husband who will scold me when he catches me doing it, and force me to go out on gloves if I won #8217;t quit. Keep trying, don #8217;t stop seeking help, and remember there are a ton of people out there who suffer from the same problem. We are here for you.
I have to pop both my ankles before I can go to sleep.

WRITING.TITLE: My husband rolled his eyes at the name I chose. He didn #8217;t understand the amount of entertainment I #8217;d get from it!

WRITING.TEXT: I just got this yesterday but was too slow to get a pic!
